name: rainwater harvesting | water, harvested from rainwater | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21591/documentation

This dataset represents a process of harvesting water from precipitation in an open system. The water harvested is driven  to a storage tank through a polypropylene piping system. There, it is stored until its potential use. The system is assumed to have a harvesting efficiency of 99% meaning that 1% of the water that could actually be harvested is lost through evaporation. The dataset finally incorporates capital costs related to the storage tank. The harvested water does not have a drinking water quality but it can then be used for irrigation, toilet flushing or construction activities like minimizing dust production during constructions or mine operations. This dataset represents a simplified version of water harvesting from rainwater. However, nowadays there are many other and well sophisticated sytems available. 

Activity starts with harvesting water through rainfall. In this dataset, the catchment area (such as roof of a house or an area of a mine) where the water is harvested is not included, as it is assumed that is not build exclusively to harvest water. 

Activity end with the use of the harvested water. The user of this dataset ought to include relevant infrastructure (i.e.: pump) as well as necessary energy consumption attributed to distribution of the water in their activity as it is not included in this dataset.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/36:Water collection, treatment and supply/360:Water collection, treatment and supply/3600:Water collection, treatment and supply

exchanges.description: The amount of water storage units needed are calculated by dividing the amount of water harvested with 2500 m3 which is the cpacity of one storage unit.

exchanges.description: Based on information of this service, 1 kg of this exchange corresponds to 0.996 kg of extruded pipes. Hence, the amount needed is calculated accordingly.

flow.name: extrusion, plastic pipes

exchanges.description: Water that is lost through evaporation. Using expert judgement it is assumed that is correspond to 1% of the water that is actually harvested.

flow.name: Water
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description: It is assumed that for one storage tank, 200 meters of pipeline are needed with 90 mm of diameter. The weight of polypropylene (PP) pipe is 0.6 kg of PP per meter. Which yields in total 120 kg of PP pipeline system. This amount is then multiplied with the amount of water storage units needed relatively to the reference product. Finally it is assumed that the pipeline system remains on site even after the end of life of the facility.
